workLog.details: Issue #998: Graph Traversal for Memory Enhancement Layer. Dependencies: #997 (Citation Schema). Exit criteria: Can traverse memory relationships, works with Serena format, CLI command functional.
Found scripts/memory_enhancement/graph.py already implemented with full BFS/DFS traversal, cycle detection, root finding, and CLI integration via __main__.py
Tested MemoryGraph class with temporary test data: BFS traversal (4 nodes, detected 1 cycle), DFS traversal with max_depth, root finding, get_related_memories. All functions work correctly.
Tested 'python -m memory_enhancement graph <root>' with --strategy (bfs/dfs), --max-depth, --json, --dir options. Text and JSON output formats work correctly.
Confirmed graph.py uses Memory.from_serena_file() which parses YAML frontmatter from .md files (Serena format). Links use LinkType enum (RELATED, SUPERSEDES, BLOCKS, IMPLEMENTS, EXTENDS).

All exit criteria satisfied: (1) Can traverse memory relationships ✓, (2) Works with Serena format ✓, (3) CLI command 'python -m memory_enhancement graph <root>' works ✓, (4) Cycle detection implemented ✓

nextSteps: Issue #998 is already complete - implementation exists and passes all tests
Consider creating tests in scripts/memory_enhancement/tests/ for regression protection
